      • getFileTypeByFileName

        public FileType getFileTypeByFileName(java.lang.String fileName)
        Description copied from class: FileTypeRegistry
        Same as FileTypeRegistry.getFileTypeByFileName(CharSequence) but receives String parameter. Consider to use the method above in case when you want to get VirtualFile's file type by file name.
        Specified by:
        getFileTypeByFileName in class FileTypeRegistry

      • getFileTypeByExtension

        public FileType getFileTypeByExtension(java.lang.String extension)
        Description copied from class: FileTypeRegistry
        Returns the file type for the specified extension. Note that a more general way of obtaining file type is with FileTypeRegistry.getFileTypeByFile(VirtualFile)
        Specified by:
        getFileTypeByExtension in class FileTypeRegistry
        Parameters:
        extension - The extension for which the file type is requested, not including the leading '.'.
        Returns:
        The file type instance, or UnknownFileType.INSTANCE if corresponding file type not found

      • isFileIgnored

        public boolean isFileIgnored(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from class: FileTypeManager
        Checks if the specified file is ignored by the IDE. Ignored files are not visible in different project views and cannot be opened in the editor. They will neither be parsed nor compiled.
        Specified by:
        isFileIgnored in class FileTypeManager
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the file to check.
        Returns:
        true if the file is ignored, false otherwise.

      • loadState

        public void loadState(Element state)
        Description copied from interface: PersistentStateComponent
        This method is called when new component state is loaded. The method can and will be called several times, if config files were externally changed while IDE was running.

        State object should be used directly, defensive copying is not required.

        Specified by:
        loadState in interface PersistentStateComponent<Element>
        Parameters:
        state - loaded component state
        See Also:
        XmlSerializerUtil.copyBean(Object, Object)

      • getState

        public Element getState()
        Specified by:
        getState in interface PersistentStateComponent<Element>
        Returns:
        a component state. All properties, public and annotated fields are serialized. Only values, which differ from the default (i.e., the value of newly instantiated class) are serialized. null value indicates that the returned state won't be stored, as a result previously stored state will be used.
        See Also:
        XmlSerializer

      • getKnownFileTypeOrAssociate

        public FileType getKnownFileTypeOrAssociate(VirtualFile file)
        Description copied from class: FileTypeManager
        If file is already associated with any known file type returns it. Otherwise asks user to select file type and associates it with fileName extension if any selected.
        Overrides:
        getKnownFileTypeOrAssociate in class FileTypeManager
        Parameters:
        file - file to ask for file type association
        Returns:
        Known file type or null. Never returns FileTypes.UNKNOWN.
